meanings.definition: The leaders or spokespeople of a group or organization.
meanings.sent1: The frontmen of the team gave a motivating speech before the game.
meanings.sent2: The frontmen of the club welcomed new members with open arms.
meanings.sent3: The frontmen of the school council organized a fun event for everyone.
meanings.sent4: The frontmen of the movement carried the message to every corner of the city.
meanings.sent5: The frontmen of the charity worked tirelessly to help those in need.

meanings.definition: Individuals who represent or promote a particular cause or idea.
meanings.sent1: The frontmen of the campaign spoke passionately about their mission.
meanings.sent2: The frontmen of the protest marched with banners and slogans.
meanings.sent3: The frontmen of the debate team argued their points with flair.
meanings.sent4: The frontmen of the environmental group planted trees in the park.
meanings.sent5: The frontmen of the charity raised awareness through social media.

meanings.definition: People who serve as the public face of a company or band.
meanings.sent1: The frontmen of the band rocked the stage with their energetic performance.
meanings.sent2: The frontmen of the company attended the product launch event.
meanings.sent3: The frontmen of the restaurant greeted customers with a smile.
meanings.sent4: The frontmen of the brand appeared in the latest advertising campaign.
meanings.sent5: The frontmen of the group posed for photos with fans after the show.
